title: How to Use the Fdisk Tool and the Format Tool to Partition a Hard Drive

steps.headline: Insert your boot diskette and turn on your pc.
At the a: prompt type fdisk then hit enter.
Click yes you want to use large disk support.
To Delete the existing partition, Type 3 and press Enter.
To re-create a new partition, Type 1 and press Enter.
steps.description:
Select what type of partition you want to create and type related value and press Enter for creating new partition. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/25\/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/25\/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: At the a: prompt type fdisk/mbr ( that fdisk your master boot record.
At the a: prompt type format c:/s/u and yes you want to erase all data so type "y" when prompted...

text:
Insert your boot diskette and turn on your pc. At the a: prompt type fdisk then hit enter. Click yes you want to use large disk support. To Delete the existing partition, Type 3 and press Enter. Select your partition type you want to delete (Primary/Extended/Logical/Non-Dos){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Select shown partition by typing the displayed number of partition and press Enter for confirmation for deleting partition. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} To re-create a new partition, Type 1 and press Enter. Select what type of partition you want to create and type related value and press Enter for creating new partition. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Use-the-Fdisk-Tool-and-the-Format-Tool-to-Partition-a-Hard-Drive-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Restart your pc. At the a: prompt type fdisk/mbr ( that fdisk your master boot record. When done, restart PC. At the a: prompt type format c:/s/u and yes you want to erase all data so type "y" when prompted...
sentences: Insert your boot diskette and turn on your pc.
At the a: prompt type fdisk then hit enter.
Click yes you want to use large disk support.
To Delete the existing partition, Type 3 and press Enter.

At the a: prompt type fdisk/mbr ( that fdisk your master boot record.
